sponsorBlurb: Support feeders, habitat work, and rescue transport.
animalLongDesc: Scotland is a key stronghold for red squirrels. Sponsorship helps fund habitat improvements, supplementary feeding in priority areas, and rescue call-outs when injured animals are reported. Your support also helps with awareness work to protect remaining populations.

sponsorBlurb: Help fund monitoring, vet care, and habitat protection.
animalLongDesc: Pine martens are elusive woodland mammals. Sponsorship can contribute to monitoring projects, emergency care for injured animals, and conservation work that protects suitable woodland habitat and safe corridors.

sponsorBlurb: Support rehabilitation, release prep, and waterway protection.
animalLongDesc: Otters rely on healthy rivers, lochs, and coastlines. Sponsorship helps with rescue and rehabilitation, specialist diets and enclosures, and education that encourages responsible wildlife watching and cleaner waterways.

sponsorBlurb: Help fund protection of nesting areas and monitoring.
animalLongDesc: Golden eagles are iconic upland predators. Sponsorship supports monitoring and protection of sensitive nesting sites, and helps fund habitat conservation and awareness work that benefits upland wildlife.

sponsorBlurb: Support monitoring, public advice, and habitat stewardship.
animalLongDesc: The white-tailed eagle is the UK’s largest bird of prey and strongly associated with coasts and islands. Sponsorship helps fund monitoring projects, guidance for responsible wildlife watching, and habitat conservation.

sponsorBlurb: Help fund nest monitoring and protection.
animalLongDesc: Ospreys are well known for breeding near freshwater and feeding on fish. Sponsorship helps with nest-site monitoring and protection, and supports local education work that reduces disturbance during breeding season.

sponsorBlurb: Support habitat management and welfare call-outs.
animalLongDesc: Red deer are an iconic Scottish species. Sponsorship supports habitat management projects and contributes to welfare support and advice where deer and people interact (especially near roads and settlements).

sponsorBlurb: Help fund conservation projects and public awareness.
animalLongDesc: Scottish wildcats are rare and need carefully managed conservation support. Sponsorship can help fund public awareness, habitat work, and long-term conservation initiatives that protect wildcat populations and reduce threats.

sponsorBlurb: Support rescue care, feeding, and release checks.
animalLongDesc: Hedgehogs are familiar garden visitors, but they still need help. Sponsorship can support short-term rescue care, safe housing, feeding, and checks before release, plus simple public guidance that makes gardens more wildlife-friendly.

sponsorBlurb: Help fund monitoring and advice for safe wildlife watching.
animalLongDesc: Harbour seals haul out on sheltered shores. Sponsorship supports monitoring work and helps fund public advice that reduces disturbance, especially during pupping season.

sponsorBlurb: Support welfare response and coastal protection work.
animalLongDesc: Grey seals are larger than harbour seals and are often seen around rocky coasts. Sponsorship can support coastal protection and welfare response guidance (e.g., how to report injured animals and avoid disturbance).

sponsorBlurb: Help fund research, sightings support, and awareness.
animalLongDesc: Bottlenose dolphins are social and often seen in groups. Sponsorship can support research and awareness work that encourages responsible wildlife watching and protects important coastal habitats.

Puffins are famous for their colourful bills and coastal colonies. Sponsorship supports monitoring and protection of breeding areas and helps fund work that reduces disturbance and supports healthy seabird habitats.

sponsorBlurb: Help fund woodland habitat support and protection.
animalLongDesc: Capercaillie are closely linked to Scottish pinewoods. Sponsorship supports woodland habitat improvements and protection efforts that benefit pinewood wildlife and reduce pressures on vulnerable species.

sponsorBlurb: Support monitoring and public reporting projects.
animalLongDesc: Red kites are graceful scavengers and opportunistic hunters. Sponsorship supports monitoring and public reporting projects that help track local populations and promote safe coexistence with wildlife.

sponsorBlurb: Help fund marine awareness and protection work.
animalLongDesc: Basking sharks are huge plankton-feeding sharks often seen off Scotland’s coasts in season. Sponsorship supports marine awareness work and protection efforts that encourage responsible boating and wildlife watching.
